value.title: FILTER Function in DAX and Power BI   Apply Custom Filter to Calculations
value.excerpt: You can apply filtering to visualization elements. However, sometimes filtering has to be done on specific calculations. This can come in handy especially when you want to compare values of other items with specific items. In this article and video, Iâ€™ll explain how to use the FILTER function in DAX

value.title: Find Lost Customers Using Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to use Power BI and DAX to find lost customers and new customers easily. If you want to see step by step blog post details, read it here: 'http://radacad.com/lost-customers-dax-calculation-for-power-bi

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #02: Add single column filter
value.excerpt: By default, a column filter in CALCULATE overwrites the existing filter over the same column. value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt

value.title: DAX Fridays! #112: Remove blanks from hierarchies with ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how you can remove blanks from hierarchies using the DAX Function ISINSCOPE. value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. value.title: DAX Fridays! #74: PREVIOUSDAY, PREVIOUSMONTH, PREVIOUSQUARTER, PREVIOUSYEAR
value.excerpt: In todayâ€™s video I we will go through how to build a time intelligence measure in DAX using the PREVIOUSDAY, PREVIOUSMONTH, PREVIOUSQUARTER, PREVIOUSYEAR.  We will first go through PREVIOUSYEAR DAX function and explain how can those functions can be combined with CALCULATE to create the correct measure.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function DATESBETWEEN.  DATESBETWEEN function allows you to calculate amounts between two dates you specify.
